original_title: Sri Lanka domestic, transshipment container volumes down in March
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s container transshipment fell 6.4 percent to 488,554 twenty foot equivalent units, in March 2023 from a year ago, official data shows, while domestic traffic fell 18.1 percent to 83,181 boxes amid a trade contraction.
Total containers handled in the first quarter were down 12.4 percent to 1.61 million TEUs
Sri Lanka exports and imports have slowed amid contraction in the domestic economy, while exports have also slowed amid an external slowdown.
In March 2023, India’s exports and imports, which drives Colombo transshipment also fell 10.3 percent to 96.4 billion US dollars.
Up to March domestic container volumes fell 28.2 percent to 227,336 TEUs.
Up to March, transshipment volumes were down 6.4 percent. (Colombo/May12/2023)
